citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL), Vents Program
citeinfo.title: Plume and CTD Data from the Juan de Fuca Ridge (PMEL Vents)

descript.abstract: Plume studies have been conducted on the Juan de Fuca Ridge each year since the inception of the VENTS program. This includes extensive conductivity-temperature-depth (CTD) mapping using both vertical casts and the "tow-yo" technique, light attenuation measurement, water sampling for chemical analysis using SUAVE.
descript.purpose: Our repeated plume measurements permit the study of the long-term evolution of seafloor venting, as well as the discovery of new vents.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
